Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/List/head
Synopsis Get the first element(s) from a list.
Function
  • &T head(list[&T] lst) throws EmptyList
  • list[&T] head(list[&T] lst, int n) throws IndexOutOfBounds(int index)
Description
  • Returns the first element of a list or throws EmptyList when the list is empty.
  • Returns the first n elements of a list or throws IndexOutOfBounds when the list is too short.
Examples 
rascal>import List;
ok
Get the first element: 
rascal>head([1, 2, 3]);
int: 1
An exception is thrown when taking the head of an empty list: 
rascal>head([]);
Uncaught Rascal Exception: prompt:///:1,0: EmptyList()
    somewhere in: public org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IValue org.rascalmpl.library.List.head(org.eclipse.imp.pdb.»
facts.IList)
    somewhere in: $shell$
Get the first n elements: 
rascal>head([1, 2, 3, 4], 2);
list[int]: [1,2]
An exception is thrown when the second argument exceeds the length of the list: 
rascal>head([1, 2, 3, 5], 5);
Uncaught Rascal Exception: prompt:///:1,0: IndexOutOfBounds(4)
    somewhere in: public org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IValue org.rascalmpl.library.List.head(org.eclipse.imp.pdb.»
facts.IList,org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IInteger) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
    somewhere in: $shell$
